alert.note: Alert for Arco, Mud Lake Desert; Bear Lake Valley; Beaverhead, Lemhi Highlands; Big Lost Highlands, Copper Basin; Blackfoot Mountains; Centennial Mountains, Island Park; Eastern Magic Valley; Frank Church Wilderness; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Lost River Range; Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region; Shoshone, Lava Beds; Teton Valley; Upper Snake River Plain; Wood River Foothills (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 04 at 2:34PM MST until January 05 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. Blowing and drifting snow is expected. * WHERE...Including the cities of Shoshone, Burley Carey, Mud Lake, INL, Craters of the Moon, Idaho Falls, Rexburg, St. Anthony, Pocatello, Blackfoot, American Falls, Fort Hall, McCammon, Lava Hot Springs, Malad, Preston, Montpelier, Soda Springs, Wayan, Swan Valley, Victor, Ashton, Tetonia, Driggs, and Island Park. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 5 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery and hazardous road conditions. Patchy blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches and cause blowing and drifting of snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution if traveling. Reschedule travel plans if possible. Travel with an emergency kit. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
